thread.title: Newton cross country wins league titles
thread.title_full: Newton cross country wins league titles

author: Chad Frey Newton Kansan @ChadFrey
title: Newton cross country wins league titles
text: Newton cross country wins league titles Comment Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 8:11 AM Updated at 8:02 AM Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 8:11 AM Updated at 8:02 AM Newton, Kan. GODDARD — Newton High School Cross Country had a good day Saturday, picking up individual and team titles at the AVCTL Division 1 League Cross Country Championships atLake Afton. Leading the way was Robert Loeffler, whose time of 16 minutes, 25.6 seconds earned him an individual title in the boys' varsity race. The Newton boys team picked up a team title as well. Newton's varsity girls finished third overall, led by a 20:40.2 finished by Alaina Stucky who finished third. Newton did earn two other titles on the day: the girls' JV won their division led by first place finisher Florencia Marble at 22:55.60. Six Newton runners earned all conference honors. Stucky, Sadie Winter, Loeffler and Caleb Nelson each earned first-team honors. Sam Blaufuss and Garrett Mick earned second team honors. Coach Richard Mick was named the conference coach of the year. Next up for the Railers is hosting a Kansas High School Activities Association Class 5A Regional Cross Country Meet Oct. 24, at Centennial Park, 1500 N. Kansas Ave . The teams scheduled to attend the Newton Regional include: Andover, Emporia, Great Bend, Newton, Salina Central, Salina South, Valley Center, and Wichita Heights. State Qualifiers are top three teams, top ten runners, and top five runners from non-qualifying teams if not in top ten. AVCL Girls Varsity Team scores — 1. Maize 41; 2. Hutchinson 54; 3. Newton 88; 4. Salina Central 100; 5. Salina Central 100; 6. Derby 119; 7. Salina South 147. Newton finishes — 3. Alaina Stucky 20:40.20; 7. Sadie Winter 21:30.10; 16. Olesya Marble 22:17.10; 29. Helaban Berquist 23:30.40. 33. Junuen Lujano 24:19.00; 38. Lupita Reyes 24:39.30; 41. Anna Vinkovits 25:55.00 Boys Varisty Team scores — 1. Newton 48; 2. Maize 70; 3. Campys 85; 4.
